variables.name: SHE-SYNC-MIB::sheSyncCgControlTimeStamp

description: The configuration of the time that has to expire before switch back to a
higher clock source after error condition.
The SYNTAX has been restricted with R3.7M to a set of fixed values,
representing within the range 0 - 15 minutes, because of HW restrictions.
Note also that the basic unit of measurement has not been changed, so that to
configure a time of 1 min, a value of 600 (600 x 100msec) is still used.

description: The configuration of the time that has to expire before switch back to a
higher clock source after error condition.
The SYNTAX has been restricted with R3.7M to a set of fixed values,
representing within the range 0 - 15 minutes, because of HW restrictions.
Note also that the basic unit of measurement has not been changed, so that to
configure a time of 1 min, a value of 600 (600 x 100msec) is still used.
variables.name: SHE-SYNC-MIB::sheSyncWaitTimeToRestore

description: The configuration of the synchronization mode to use for synchronization
revertive(1) : The highest priority sync source with a valid reference
nonrevertive(2) : The active sync source will always remain active so long
as it remains valid. Only if the sync source becomes invalid
will a switchover to a valid reference source with highest
variables.name: SHE-SYNC-MIB::sheSyncMode

description: The configuration of the SSM level for the local clock.
The SSM level for the local clock is transmitted, if all selected clock sources
fail and the NE uses its own internal clock reference (free run) for synchronization.
The level is defined in 16 steps from 0..15, where 0 is the highest quality level.
Code G.781 Option I G.781 Option II G.8264

event.Summary: Type of available sync source reconfigured: $v2

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-SYNC-MIB::sheSyncCgControlTimeStamp

description: The type of the synchronization source of the network element.
sheT3orE1SyncSource(2) : CLK1/CLK2 input on PM module;
sheBitsSyncSource(3) : CLK1/CLK2 input on PM module;
clock mode has been set to BITS
sheT3SyncSource(8) : CLK1/CLK2 input on PM module;
clock mode has been set to T3
sheE1SyncSource(9) : CLK1/CLK2 input on PM module;
clock mode has been set to E1
The NE cannot automatically determine the clocking mode used for CLK1/CLK2 and,
therefore, this needs to be configured by the user for correct operation.
The configuration applies to both CLK1 and CLK2, i.e., these two clock inputs
can only be configured for the same clocking mode.

description: A status object reporting the clock synchronization source that is
0 : No synchronizaton source is available or configured;
the T4 output is switched OFF.
1..2 : Identifies an entry in the sheSyncSourceAvailabilityTable.
- T4 output is only available on the CXU_D1, CXU_G1 and CXU_G11.
- If T4 was configured in sheSyncExtT4Source to be derived from the system clock, T0,
this object nevertheless points to the valid clock source in the
sheSyncSourceAvailabilityTable from which T0 is currently derived.

description: This alarm is raised only if NO sheSyncExtT4NoSSMInfoAlarm
is raised AND the received QL of the configured input used
as source for the T4 output falls below the minimum allowed
QL level as configured in sheSyncExtT4MinQL, in which case
the output of T4 will have been squelched.
This alarm is only possible on a CXU_D1, CXU_G1 or CXU_G11.
